security_audit.summary: This skill is a documentation-only resource that provides guidance for creating SKILL.md files. It contains no executable code, network calls, file system access, or other potentially dangerous capabilities. The content is purely educational and instructional.

content.value_statement: Writing effective SKILL.md files is challenging without proper guidance. This skill provides comprehensive templates, examples, and best practices to create skills that Claude can understand and execute reliably.
actual_capabilities: Provides step-by-step guidance for creating SKILL.md files
Offers ready-to-use templates for different skill types
Includes good and bad examples with detailed explanations
Teaches proper naming conventions and description writing
Explains when to use different levels of detail and autonomy
limitations: Only creates documentation, no executable code generation
Focuses on Claude Agent skills specifically
Requires user to write actual skill implementation
Templates need customization for specific use cases

use_cases.title: Create Custom Skills
use_cases.description: Build personalized skills that extend Claude's capabilities for specific workflows and project requirements.

use_cases.title: Standardize Team Skills
use_cases.description: Establish consistent skill documentation standards across team members for better collaboration.

use_cases.title: Document AI Workflows
use_cases.description: Create clear, actionable documentation for AI-assisted processes and automation tasks.

prompt_templates.title: Basic Skill Creation
prompt_templates.prompt: Help me create a skill that [describe what your skill should do]. I want it to activate when users mention [trigger words].

prompt_templates.title: Workflow Skill Design
prompt_templates.prompt: I need to create a skill that handles [complex workflow]. It should guide Claude through steps including [list key steps].

prompt_templates.title: Skill Improvement
prompt_templates.prompt: Review my existing skill and suggest improvements based on best practices. Here's my current SKILL.md: [paste your content].

prompt_templates.title: Template Selection
prompt_templates.prompt: Which template should I use for a skill that [describe your use case]? I need [specific requirements].

output_examples.input: Help me create a skill for reviewing Python code quality
output: Provides a complete SKILL.md template with proper structure
Includes specific trigger scenarios for code review requests
Shows example review criteria and output format
Offers best practices for code review automation

best_practices: Start with the basic template and expand based on your specific needs
Include 3-5 clear trigger scenarios in the 'When to Use' section
Use real code examples, not pseudocode, in your skill documentation
Test your skill by using the trigger words in conversation
anti_patterns: Don't include general programming knowledge Claude already knows
Avoid vague descriptions like 'helps with code' - be specific
Don't write tutorial-style content - focus on work instructions
Never skip the validation and troubleshooting sections

faq.question: How long should my SKILL.md file be?
faq.answer: Aim for 200-500 lines. If longer, split into sub-files and reference them. Concise skills are more effective.

faq.question: Can I use these templates for any type of skill?
faq.answer: Yes, the templates work for any domain. Adapt the examples and workflows to your specific use case.

faq.question: How do I make my skill easier to activate?
faq.answer: Include specific keywords in your description that users would naturally say when they need your skill.

faq.question: Should I include error handling in my skill?
faq.answer: Always include troubleshooting sections. They help Claude handle failures gracefully and guide users to solutions.

faq.question: What's the difference between basic and workflow templates?
faq.answer: Basic templates are for simple tasks. Workflow templates handle multi-step processes with decision points and validation.

faq.question: How often should I update my skills?
faq.answer: Review skills quarterly or when tools/APIs change. Update based on usage feedback and effectiveness.
